etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") with 冖 (mì, "cover") added -> enclosure -> closed
etymology.interpretation: The character 冋(冋) (jiōng, "closed") combines 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") representing an enclosed space and 冖 (mì, "cover") to emphasize the notion of being contained or closed off. This reflects the idea of an enclosed or bounded space.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临时(夜幕降臨時)，小店冋了(小店冋了)。
examples.pinyin: Yè mù jiàng lín shí, xiǎo diàn jiōng le.
examples.english: When night falls, the little shop is closed.
